description: Consider joining forces with another advisor to capitalize on DOL Opportunities

resourceStepList.title: Understand Teaming Dynamics
resourceStepList.description: The increasing client, operational and regulatory demands caused by the DOL's new Fiduciary Rule will force many advisors - especially those operating in historically solo practioner business models - to consider partnering or teaming with other financial professionals. In doing so, advisors can create the necessary scale to navigate DOL as well as offer end clients a more comprehensive client service experience.

resourceItems.description: Read: Best Practices of Elite Teams
Read: Building a High Performing Team

resourceStepList.title: Determine Complimentary Skills
resourceStepList.description: Identifying your strengths and weaknesses - and then surrounding yourself with complimentary professionals - is one of the hallmarks of teaming. Taking the opportunity to go through an introspective self-assessment before expanding your organization can ensure each step of the teaming process is done correctly.

resourceStepList.title: Initiate Formal Search Process
resourceStepList.description: Finding the right person(s) to team with doesn't need to be overwhelming if you have a plan and stick to it. Be patient, as you want to make sure you find the right person(s) to partner with. Methodically and consistently review potential partners and teammates against your goals and the skills or services you want to expand into.

resourceStepList.title: Consult your Dedicated Business Consultant or Relationship Manager to Leverage Pentameter
resourceStepList.description: Pentameter is your best place to build your DOL business goals and track your progress.  Speak with your dedicated Business Consultant or Relationship Manager to translate your DOL goals into your business plan.
